'''Gregg Carey''', Co-founder
'''Katharine Nielson, PhD.''', Chief Education Officer | industry = [[E-Learning]] | homepage = [http://www.voxy.com www.voxy.com] }} '''Voxy''' is a web-based English [[eLearning]] company providing institutions with an adaptive, dynamic curriculum and personalized instruction.{{cite web|url=https://venturebeat.com/2010/09/28/voxy-language-learning-media/|title=Voxy teaches languages through news and text messages|author=Matthew Lynley|publisher=Venture Beat|date=September 28, 2010|accessdate=October 9, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.maswired.com/voxy-music-turns-songs-into-english-lessons/|title=Voxy Music turns songs into English lessons|author=Elaine Rita Mendus|publisher=Maswired|date=September 24, 2012|accessdate=October 9, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2012/07/27/startups-education-online/|title=5 Startups Transforming Online Education|publisher=Mashable|date=July 27, 2012|accessdate=October 14, 2013}} Voxy has three million users in more than 20 countries, and has been rated the #1 education app in 23 countries.{{cite web|url=https://venturebeat.com/2013/08/02/voxy-gets-8-5m-for-its-english-language-learning-apps/|title=Voxy gets $8.5M for its English-language learning apps|author=Christina Farr|publisher=Venture Beat|date=August 2, 2013|accessdate=October 9, 2013}} Voxy was founded in February 2010 by Gregg Carey and [[Paul Gollash]]. The company is headquartered in [[NoHo]], [[New York City]], and also has an office in [[São Paulo]], [[Brazil]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=117432068 |title=Company Overview of Voxy, Inc |author= |website=bloomberg.com |publisher=Bloomberg LP |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/the-hottest-10-startups-to-watch-in-nyc-this-year-2012-2 |title=The Hottest 10 Startups To Watch In NYC This Year |last1=Huhman |first1=Heather |date=21 February 2012 |website=businessinsider.com |publisher=Business Insider Inc |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/voxy |title=Voxy |author= |website=crunchbase.com |publisher=AOL Inc |access-date=27 June 2015}} ==History== Voxy officially launched at TechCrunch Disrupt 2010 in San Francisco. The executive chairman of the Voxy board is Timothy Murray.{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/timothy-murray-joins-voxys-board-of-directors-as-executive-chairman-300273617.html|title=Timothy Murray Joins Voxy's Board of Directors as Executive Chairman|work=PR Newswire|date=May 24, 2016}} PhD linguist Katharine B. Nielson is the chief education officer.{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbesleadershipforum/2014/05/08/three-surprising-ways-to-use-technology-to-learn-a-language/ |title=Three Surprising Ways to Use Technology to Learn a Language |last1=Nielson |first1=Katharine |date=8 May 2014 |website=forbes.com |publisher=Forbes, Inc |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.wnyc.org/story/please-explain-how-we-learn-foreign-language/ |title=Some Tips on How To Learn a Foreign Language |last1=Lopate |first1=Leonard |date=27 June 2014 |website=wnyc.org |publisher=New York Public Radio |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://www.icelw.org/program/ICELW%202013%20Proceedings/ICELW2013/papers/Nielson.pdf |title=Online Language Learning in the Workplace: Maximizing Efficiency, Effectiveness, and Timeon-Task |last1=Nielson |first1=Katharine |date=12 June 2013 |website=icelw.org |publisher=The International Conference on E-Learning in the Workplace |access-date=24 April 2015}} In 2014, after receiving increased interest in the Voxy platform from several universities, Voxy expanded its offerings to corporations and educational institutions. Voxy software is used by universities, language institutes, and corporations in countries including Brazil, [[Mexico]], [[Colombia]], [[the United States]], Argentina, Vietnam, Taiwan, Saudi Arabia, Russia, Italy and [[Spain]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wiredacademic.com/2012/07/interview-language-learning-startup-voxy-focusing-on-growth-in-brazil-latin-america/|title=Interview: Language Learning Startup Voxy Focusing On Growth In Brazil, Latin America|author=Paul Gladder|publisher=Wired Academic|date=July 16, 2012|accessdate=May 22, 2015}} In 2013, Voxy partnered with [[Pearson PLC]] to expand to more countries including China.{{cite web |url=http://pando.com/2013/08/02/voxy-is-a-different-english-teacher-for-the-new-global-economy/ |title=Voxy is a different English teacher for the new global economy |last1=Mott |first1=Nathaniel |date=2 August 2013 |website=pando.com |publisher=Pando Daily |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://gigaom.com/2013/08/02/language-learning-heats-up-voxy-gets-8-5m-to-help-the-world-learn-english/|title=Language learning heats up: Voxy gets $8.5M to help the world learn English|author=Ki Mae Heussner|publisher=Gigaom|date=August 3, 2013|accessdate=May 22, 2015}} The company developed an online English course for Internet multinational [[Terra Networks]].{{cite web |url=http://noticias.terra.com.br/educacao/terra-lanca-cursos-de-ingles-personalizados-em-parceria-com-a-voxycom,9532f6ac7c125410VgnCLD2000000dc6eb0aRCRD.html |title=Terra lança cursos de inglês personalizados em parceria com a Voxy.com |author= |date=2 April 2014 |website=Noticias.terra.com.br |access-date=24 April 2015}} Voxy’s biggest market is Brazil. Prior to the [[2014 World Cup]] in [[Brazil]], Voxy distributed its English language-learning platform to 40,000 affiliates of the [[taxicab|car service]] 99Taxis.{{cite web |url=http://www.fastcompany.com/3030750/most-creative-people/ahead-of-the-world-cup-voxy-rolls-out-english-language-learning-for-bra |title=Ahead of the World Cup, Voxy Rolls Out English Language Learning for Brazilian Cabbies |last1=Zax |first1=David |date=20 May 2014 |website=fastcompany.com |publisher=Mansueto Ventures, LLC |access-date=24 April 2015}}{{cite web |url=http://qz.com/210192/a-language-app-is-getting-brazils-taxi-drivers-in-shape-for-the-world-cup/ |title=A language app is getting Brazil’s taxi drivers in shape for the World Cup |last1=Feltman |first1=Rachel |date=16 May 2014 |website=qz.com |publisher=Atlantic Media |access-date=24 April 2015}} In 2014, Voxy announced a partnership with Brothers For All, a South African nonprofit dedicated to providing educational support to ex-inmates of the South African prison system and at-risk youth.{{cite web|url=https://d2gcdhp37krz23.cloudfront.net/uploads/PR-Brother-for-all.pdf|title=Voxy Partners With Brothers For All In Helping Ex-Inmates Prepare For Digital World|author=Voxy|date=December 10, 2014|accessdate=March 6, 2015}} Voxy donated free software licenses to the new Brothers For All study center in [[Langa, South Africa]], giving students in an underserved community full access to Voxy’s platform and credits to enroll in live group classes. In December 2015, Voxy received a patent for its customized keyword extraction process for second language learning.{{citeweb|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/voxy-patents-innovative-approach-to-second-language-learning-300196480.html|title=Voxy Patents Innovative Approach to Second Language Learning|publisher=PR Newswire|date=22 December 2015|access-date=25 January 2016}} ==Product== Voxy is built on the principles of [[task-based language learning]], and tailors every single course based on learners’ daily performance, proficiency levels, personal goals, and interests.{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/shamahyder/2014/09/08/15-tech-companies-taking-nyc-by-storm/ |title=15 Tech Companies Taking NYC By Storm |last1=Hyder |first1=Shama |date=8 September 2014 |website=forbes.com |publisher=Forbes Inc |access-date=24 April 2015}} The Voxy curriculum uses authentic content that is relevant to learners, including up-to-date news articles from leading publishers, English songs, videos of people accomplishing daily tasks, and audio recordings of real-life situations. Voxy delivers a fully integrated web and mobile platform that syncs across all of a user’s devices.{{cite web|url=http://www.maswired.com/mobile-app-voxy-helps-latinos-learn-english/|title=Mobile app Voxy helps Latinos learn English|publisher=Maswired|date=August 1, 2012|accessdate=October 14, 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://smallbusiness.foxbusiness.com/entrepreneurs/2012/01/05/startups-aim-to-bring-education-industry-into-21st-century/ |title=Startups Aim to Bring Education Industry Into 21st Century |publisher=Fox Business|date=January 5, 2012|accessdate=October 14, 2013}} The platform includes live in-product instruction through one-on-one tutoring sessions and group classes with certified teachers who provide real-time feedback.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mariela-dabbah/immigrants-must-learn-eng_b_1107647.html|title=Immigrants Must Learn English Fast|publisher=Huffington Post|date=November 23, 2011|accessdate=October 14, 2013}} Voxy also offers advanced reporting, dashboard visualization, and performance analytics to keep track of how learners are doing. To assess proficiency level at the beginning of the program, Voxy uses its own proprietary test, the Voxy Proficiency Assessment™ (VPA™). Learners can retake the VPA™ every three months to measure their improvement, and courses will automatically adapt to updated proficiency levels. Voxy has pioneered numerous innovations in [[contextual learning]], including the use of [[natural language processing]] tools and [[geo-location]]. ==Funding== In its [[Series A]] round, Voxy received $4.1 million in funding from investors including Weld North, New York City Investment Fund (NYCIF), Seavest Inc., Contour Venture Partners, and ff Venture Capital. Voxy received $2.3 million in funding from return investors including [[ff Venture Capital]], Contour Venture Partners, and Seavest Capital Partners in a [[Series B|Series A-2]] round in 2012.{{cite web|url=http://betabeat.com/2012/03/voxy-raises-4-million-ff-venture-capital-contour-venture-partners-seavest-language-learning-app-03262012/|title=Language Learning Startup Voxy Raises a $4 M. Round from ff Venture Capital, Contour, and Seavest|publisher=Beta Beat|date=March 26, 2012|accessdate=May 22, 2015}} In 2013, Voxy received $8.5 million from Pearson in a [[Series B]] with participation from Rethink Education. Voxy raised a $12 million funding found in March 2017, which was dedicated to the expansion of its e-learning app. The funding round was led by SFJ Ventures.{{cite web| url=https://venturebeat.com/2017/03/30/voxy-raises-12-million-to-roll-out-its-e-learning-english-app-in-emerging-markets/| publisher=Venture Beat| title=Voxy raises $12 million to roll out its e-learning English app in emerging markets| access-date=April 25, 2017| author=Berenice Magistretti| date=March 30, 2017}} ==Awards and recognition== [[Business Insider]] named Voxy one of the 10 best U.S. technology companies to work for in 2012,{{cite web|url=http://articles.businessinsider.com/2012-03-17/news/31195914_1_employees-vote-la-mode-aaron-levie|title=The 10 Best US Tech Companies To Work For In 2012|author=Heather R. Huhman|publisher=Business Insider|date=March 17, 2012|accessdate=October 9, 2013}} and Internet Week New York named Voxy one of the top 30 places to work in the New York City tech industry in 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.internetweekny.com/media/press_releases/52|title=Internet Week Unveils Its First-Ever List Of 30 Best Places To Work In New York City Tech Industry|author=Jenny Chang, Mark McArthur|publisher=Internet Week|date=October 17, 2014|accessdate=March 6, 2015}} In 2015, Voxy was recognized as an Academics' Choice Award Winner for "Smart Media."{{cite web| url=http://www.academicschoice.com/websites/voxy.php| title=Voxy| publisher=Academics' Choice| access-date=August 26, 2015}} ==See also== * [[Distance learning]] * [[E-Learning]] * [[Language education]] * [[English as a second language]] * [[Second language acquisition]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://voxy.com Voxy.com] - Official website [[Category:Language education]] [[Category:Companies established in 2010]] [[Category:Companies based in New York City]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} '''Wolong National Nature Reserve''' ({{zh|s=卧龙自然保护区|t=臥龍自然保護區|p=Wòlóng Zìránbǎohùqū}}) is a [[protected area]] located in [[Wenchuan County]], [[Sichuan Province]], People's Republic of China. Established in 1963 with an initial size of about 20,000 hectares, the reserve was further expanded in 1975, covering an area of about 200,000 hectares in the [[Qionglai Mountains]] region. There are over 4,000 different species recorded in the reserve.<ref name="about">[http://www.chinawolong.com/doce/about.htm About Wolong], Wolong National Natural Reserve.</ref> According to China's Third National Giant Panda Survey, Wolong National Nature Reserve houses about 150 wild individuals of highly endangered [[giant panda]]s. The reserve is also a home to many other endangered species including: [[snow leopard]]s, [[red pandas]], [[golden snub-nosed monkey|golden monkey]]s, [[white-lipped deer]] and many precious plants. Before the devastating [[2008 Sichuan earthquake|2008 Wenchuan earthquake]] Wolong got up to 200,000 visitors every year.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Liu|first=Wei|last2=Vogt|first2=Christine A.|last3=Luo|first3=Junyan|last4=He|first4=Guangming|last5=Frank|first5=Kenneth A.|last6=Liu|first6=Jianguo|date=2012-04-25|title=Drivers and Socioeconomic Impacts of Tourism Participation in Protected Areas|url=http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0035420|journal=PLOS ONE|volume=7|issue=4|pages=e35420|doi=10.1371/journal.pone.0035420|issn=1932-6203|pmc=3338832|pmid=22558149}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Liu|first=Wei|last2=Vogt|first2=Christine A.|last3=Lupi|first3=Frank|last4=He|first4=Guangming|last5=Ouyang|first5=Zhiyun|last6=Liu|first6=Jianguo|date=2016-02-01|title=Evolution of tourism in a flagship protected area of China|url=https://dx.doi.org/10.1080/09669582.2015.1071380|journal=Journal of Sustainable Tourism|volume=24|issue=2|pages=203–226|doi=10.1080/09669582.2015.1071380|issn=0966-9582}}</ref> Its area is superseded by the [[Wolong Special Administrative Region]].
== Background == In June 1980, the China Conservation and Research Center for the Giant Panda was established at Wolong with the efforts of both [[World Wildlife Fund|World Wildlife Fund (WWF)]] and the Chinese government. To this date, researchers have conducted many breeding research projects on giant pandas and have successfully bred 66 panda cubs.<ref name="about"/>
== Location == [[File:Lil regale 04Infl China Sichuan Wolong 18 06 04.jpg|thumb|upright|''[[Lilium regale]]'', a local native flower]] A mountain stream runs through the Wolong Valley (where the reserve is); the stream is heavily armoured with boulders and smaller rounded stones. Stream waters are rather [[alkaline]] with [[pH]] levels in the range of 8.91. (Hogan, 2007) [[Water quality]] [[turbidity]] is quite high due to extensive sand and [[gravel]] mining in stream.<ref>Hogan, C.M., Lumina Tech, ''Environmental analysis of the Wolong National Nature Reserve'' (2007)</ref>
According to a 2001 research by Dr. Jianguo Liu of [[Michigan State University]], the rate of destruction is higher after the reserve's creation than before its creation.<ref>Liu, Jianuo, Marc Linderman, Zhiyun Ouyang, Li An, Jian Yang, and Hemin Zhang. "Ecological Degradation in Protected Areas: The Case of Wolong Nature Reserve for Giant Pandas." ''Science'' 292.5514 (2001): 98-101. Web. 18 Feb. 2016.</ref> Using [[NASA]]'s satellite images and records of population, Liu's research team concluded that due to tourism and the increase in local population, the reserve is facing an unprecedented threat. "Tourists don't think they have an impact on panda habitat, but indirectly each visitor has some impact," Liu said. "We don't see ourselves as a destructive force, but we are."<ref>(April 6, 2001) [http://www.ens-newswire.com/ens/apr2001/2001-04-06-02.asp Endangered Pandas Not Safe in Chinese Nature Reserve], Environment News Service.</ref>
== Fauna == The giant panda is the most famous species of the reserve. Other typical larger Carnivora are the [[Ussuri dhole]], [[Asian black bear]], [[Asiatic golden cat]], [[red panda]], [[hog badger]] and [[yellow-throated marten]]. Hooved mammals are represented by [[Sichuan takin]]s, [[wild boar]], [[musk deer]], [[mainland serow]]s, [[Chinese goral]]s, [[tufted deer]] and [[sambar deer]]. Other noticeable mammals include [[golden snub-nosed monkey]]s, [[Tibetan macaque]]s, [[complex-toothed flying squirrel]]s, [[Rhizomys|bamboo rat]]s, and [[Old World porcupine|porcupine]]s.<ref name="Johnson1993">{{cite journal |author1=Johnson, Kenneth G. |author2=Wei, Wang |author3=Reid, Donald G. |author4=Jinchu, Hu |title=Food Habits of Asiatic Leopards (''Panthera pardus fusea'') in Wolong Reserve, Sichuan, China |work=[[Journal of Mammalogy]] |volume=74 |number=3 |date=August 1993 |pages=646–650}}</ref> Because the reserve comprises different altitudes, it includes tropical and temperate climate zones and harbors species typically for the tropics, like [[clouded leopard]]s and sambar deer as well as species from temperate regions, like [[white-lipped deer]], [[snow leopard]]s and [[Turkestan lynx]]es.<ref name="Riley&Riley2005">{{cite book |last1=Riley |first1=William |last2=Riley |first2=Laura |title=Nature´s Strongholds. The World´s Great Wildlife Reserves |publisher=[[Princeton University Press]] |year=2005 |isbn=0-691-12219-9}}</ref> Camera-trap surveys conducted in the reserve area between 2005 and 2009 did not record any [[leopard]].<ref>{{cite journal |authors=Li, S., Wang, D., Lu, Z. & Mc Shea, W.J. |year=2010 |title=Cats living with pandas: The status of wild felids within giant panda range, China |journal=Cat News 52 |pages=20–23}}</ref>
== 2008 earthquake == [[File:Broken panda house.jpg|thumb|Many giant panda houses were broken in the 2008 Sichuan earthquake]]
The region, including the Panda Research Center, was largely devastated by the catastrophic May 12, [[2008 Sichuan earthquake]], though the captive giant pandas were initially reported to be safe.<ref>(May 14, 2008). [http://www.pandasinternational.org/news/quake_letter3.html Pandas International].</ref><ref>(May 13, 2008). [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/7397935.stm Pandas 'safe' at park after quake].</ref> Immediately after the quake, officials were unable to contact the reserve.<ref>{{cite news|title=Report: Rare giant pandas at Chinese breeding center safe after quake| date=2008-05-13|work=International Herald Tribune|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2008/05/13/asia/AS-GEN-China-Quake-Pandas.php|accessdate = 2008-05-20}}</ref> PRC’s Foreign Ministry later said that a group of 31 British tourists visiting the Wolong panda reserve in the quake-hit area returned safe and uninjured to the provincial capital. The well-being of an even greater number of pandas in the neighbouring panda reserves initially remained unknown. Five security guards at the reserve were killed by the earthquake.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/id/138079/|title=Animal Instinct|last=Liu|first=Melinda|date=2008-05-21|series=China Earthquake|work=Newsweek|accessdate=2008-06-10 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080614033628/http://www.newsweek.com/id/138079/ <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-06-14}}</ref> Six pandas escaped after their enclosures were damaged. By May 20, two pandas at the reserve were found to be injured, while the search continued for another two adult pandas that went missing after the quake.<ref>{{cite news|title=Two pandas missing in China quake region|date=2008-05-20|publisher=[[United Press International|UPI]]|url=http://www.upi.com/NewsTrack/Top_News/2008/05/20/two_pandas_missing_in_china_quake_region/6711/|accessdate=2008-05-20}}</ref> By May 28, 2008, one panda was still missing,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/05/29/china.pandas.ap/index.html|title=Panda reserve mulls moving after quake damage|author=[[Associated Press]]|date= 2008-05-29|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2008-05-29 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080601053533/http://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/05/29/china.pandas.ap/index.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2008-06-01}}</ref> nine-year-old [[Mao Mao (panda)|Mao Mao]], a mother of five at the breeding centre. She was discovered on Monday, June 9, her body crushed by a wall in her enclosure.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-06/10/content_8341008.htm|title=One panda confirmed dead in China quake|last=Yan|first=Yangtze|date=2008-06-10|work=Window of China|publisher=Xinhua News Agency|accessdate=2008-06-10}}</ref> Panda keepers and other workers placed her remains in a small wooden crate and buried her outside the breeding centre.
For the time being the giant pandas have been relocated to the [[Bifengxia Panda Base]], which is also managed by the China Panda Protection and Research Center.<ref name="travelchina">{{cite web|title=Wolong National Natural Reserve |url=http://www.travelchinaguide.com/attraction/sichuan/chengdu/wolong.htm|publisher=TravelChinaGuide.com}}</ref>
